newsitem.title: LEBANON: Lebanese pound continues rise on dollar in week. [CORRECTED 14:50 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Lebanese pound continues rise on dollar in week. [CORRECTED 14:50 GMT]

text.p: The Lebanese pound continued to rise against the dollar in the week ended on Friday and dealers said the central bank intervened as a buyer of up to $25 million (corrects figure from $40 million).

The Bank of Lebanon lowered its bid-offer intervention band during the week to 1,537.5-1,547 pounds per dollar from 1,538-1,547.5 and the dollar traded at the bottom of the band throughout the week, dealers said.

"The dollar was offered throughout the week. It fell one pound to 1,537.5 to the dollar in inter-bank trading from 1,538.5." a dealer told Reuters. (Changes comment and source). The dollar's supply was high and trade was restricted to a tight range of up to 50 piasters at the bid end of the intervention band, putting it at 1,537.60-1,538, she added.
Last week the dollar closed at 1,538.25-1,539 pound in interbank trading.
